textMeaning: If something is wide, it is large from side to side.
textExample: The door was as wide as my arms.

textMeaning: Advice is an opinion about what to do.
textExample: I don’t know how to study for my exams. Can you give me some advice?

textMeaning: To attract means to make a person or thing come closer or be interested.
textExample: The magnet attracted the metal.

textMeaning: Along means down the length of a road, river, etc.
textExample: Walk along this tunnel for ten minutes, and you’ll see a door on the left.

textMeaning: Attention is the notice, thought, or consideration of someone.
textExample: His work got the attention of two of his co-workers.

textMeaning: To climb means to use your hands and feet to go up something.
textExample: The girls climbed to the top of the mountain.

textMeaning: To drop is to fall or allow something to fall.
textExample: A small amount of water dropped from the bottle.

textMeaning: If something is final, it is the last part.
textExample: In the final part of the film, the man and the woman got married.

textMeaning: Further means at or from a greater distance or time.
textExample: The escalator is further than I thought.

textMeaning: To imply something is to suggest it without saying it.
textExample: The man implied that he wanted the job, but he didn’t say so.

textMeaning: To maintain means to make something stay the same.
textExample: The balls maintain constant movement.

textMeaning: You use neither to connect two negative possibilities.
textExample: Neither the path on the left nor the path on the right will lead us home.

textMeaning: Otherwise means in another way if you don’t do this.
textExample: It’s good to stay active; otherwise, you’ll gain weight.

textMeaning: To prove something is to show that it is true.
textExample: My teacher proved the answer on the board.

textMeaning: If something is physical, it is related to your body and not your mind.
textExample: Biking is good for your physical health.

textExample: James reacted badly to the news.

textMeaning: To ride something is to travel on it. You can ride an animal, a bike, etc.
textExample: I will ride a roller coaster for the first time today.

textMeaning: If something is situated somewhere, it is in that place.

textMeaning: Society is a group of people who interact and share a culture.

textMeaning: A standard is what people consider normal or good.

textMeaning: To suggest something means to give an idea or plan about it.
textExample: He suggested that we go to see his boss.

textExample: My dad looks a little mean, but actually he’s very kind.

textMeaning: Bite is the act of using your teeth to cut and tear into something.
textExample: The boy took a big bite of his hamburger.

textMeaning: The coast is the land by an ocean.
textExample: I stayed on the southern coast of Australia.

textMeaning: A deal is an agreement that you have with another person.
textExample: I made a deal with the other company to give us some money.

textMeaning: The desert is an area of land without many plants or water.
textExample: Not many plants grow in the desert.

textMeaning: If something is effective, it works well.

textMeaning: To examine something is to look at it carefully.
textExample: The doctor examined my eyes today.

textMeaning: If something is false, it is not correct.
textExample: If you think the answer is false, press the red button.

textMeaning: When you figure something out, you come to understand it and find an answer.
textExample: I couldn’t figure out what he wanted me to do.

textMeaning: A gift is something you give someone.
textExample: Dave received many gifts for Christmas.

textMeaning: Hunger is the feeling that you get when you need to eat.
textExample: After playing all day long, he was filled with hunger.

textMeaning: To imagine something is to think of it in your mind.
textExample: Sally imagined herself winning lots of money.

textMeaning: A journey is a long trip.

textMeaning: A puzzle is something that is hard to understand.
textExample: The question was a puzzle to him.

textMeaning: Quite means that something is a certain way completely or very much.

textMeaning: Rather is used when you want to do one thing but not the other.
textExample: I would rather have the red one than the blue one.

textMeaning: If something is specific, it is precise or exact.

textMeaning: A spider is a small creature with eight legs.

textMeaning: A tour is a short trip in which you see many sights.

textMeaning: A trip is a journey to a certain place.

textMeaning: A band is a group of people who play music.
textExample: My brother is in a rock band.

textMeaning: Barely means by the smallest amount, almost not.

textMeaning: If something is boring, it is not fun.
textExample: I think the Internet is boring.

textMeaning: A driveway is a short private road that leads to a person’s home.

textMeaning: Garbage is waste material like unwanted or spoiled food, bottles, paper, etc.

textMeaning: An instrument is something designed to do a certain task like play music.
textExample: My favorite musical instrument is the piano.

textMeaning: A list is a record of information printed with an item on each line.
textExample: My mom makes a list of groceries to buy.

textMeaning: Magic is the power to do impossible things.

textMeaning: A message is a set of words that you send to someone.
textExample: I left a message for you in the envelope.

textMeaning: To notice something is to see it for the first time.
textExample: Did you notice the view?

textMeaning: To own something means to have it. That thing belongs to you.
textExample: My grandfather owns that house.

textMeaning: To predict something is to say that it will happen.
textExample: She predicted that I would get married next year.

textMeaning: To rush is to go somewhere or do something very quickly.
textExample: Nancy rushed to finish her homework.

textMeaning: A professor is a person who teaches in college.

textMeaning: A schedule is a plan that tells you when to do things.
textExample: What is your class schedule for today?

textMeaning: To share something is to give some of it to another person.

textMeaning: A stage is a place where actors or musicians act or sing.

textMeaning: A storm is very bad weather. There is a lot of rain or snow.

textExample: We both compromised about the game we decided to play.

textMeaning: To craft something is to make it using skill.

textMeaning: When you dive into water, you go down head first into the water.

textMeaning: When people or things are fragile, they are not strong and can be damaged easily.

textMeaning: If you cut something into two parts that are the same size, you cut it half.

textMeaning: Innocence is a lack of experience of difficult or complex things in life.

textMeaning: When you lead something, you go first and it follows you.

textExample: The storm clouds merged into one large menacing cloud that filled the sky.

textMeaning: When something is moderate, it is not too big or too small in size or amount.

textMeaning: A perception of a situation is a way of thinking about it or understanding it.

textMeaning: When you settle something, you reach an agreement.
textExample: We settled the argument by looking up the answer on the web.

textMeaning: A shiver is a shaking movement the body makes when someone is cold or scared.

textMeaning: When someone is sociable, they are friendly.

textMeaning: When you speed, you go very fast.

textMeaning: When someone is talkative, he or she talks a lot.

textMeaning: When something is usual, it is what we expect.
textExample: It was just the usual people who came.

textMeaning: If something is above, it is at a higher level than something else.

textMeaning: If something is ahead of something else, it is in front of it.
textExample: The blue car drove on ahead of us.

textMeaning: A belief is a strong feeling that something is correct or true.

textMeaning: To cost is to require payment.

textMeaning: To demonstrate something is to show how it is done.

textMeaning: Different describes someone or something that is not the same as others.

textMeaning: If something is common, it happens often or there is much of it.

textMeaning: Evidence is a fact or thing that you use to prove something.

textMeaning: If something is independent, it is not controlled by something else.

textMeaning: Honesty means the quality of being truthful or honest.

textMeaning: Inside means the inner part, space or side of something.

textMeaning: An idiom is a phrase with a meaning different from its words.

textMeaning: A jail is a place to keep bad people.

textMeaning: A master is a person who is very good at something.

textMeaning: A memory is something you remember.

textMeaning: A pocket is a part of your clothing where you can keep things.

textMeaning: If something is for sale, you can buy it.
textExample: Everything for sale here is the same price.

textMeaning: East is the direction the sun rises from.

textMeaning: Expensive things cost a lot of money.

textMeaning: A flower is the colored part of a plant.

textMeaning: A garden is an area where people grow plants.

textMeaning: A holiday is a special day of celebration.

textMeaning: A mountain is a very high hill.

textMeaning: A place is a space or area.

textMeaning: A popular thing is liked by many people.

textMeaning: To ski is to glide on long pieces of wood or metal over snow.

textMeaning: A tower is a tall, narrow building.
textExample: This is a very famous tower in Italy.

textMeaning: Such means “like this”.
textExample: I have never seen such a beautiful sunset before.

textMeaning: Total shows that everyone or everything has been counted.

textMeaning: A train is a group of railway cars connected together.
textExample: The train is very fast, so we can get home in one hour.

textMeaning: To walk is to move forward using legs, but it is slower than running.

textMeaning: The world is the Earth and all the people and things in it.

textMeaning: To watch is to look at someone or something for a period of time.

textExample: Her performance last night was awful.

textMeaning: To consist of certain is to be made of parts or things them.

textMeaning: To desire is to want something.

textMeaning: Eager shows excitement about something.

textMeaning: A household is all the people who live in one house.

textMeaning: An intent is a plan to do something.

textMeaning: A landscape is how an area of land looks.

textMeaning: To lift something is to move it higher.

textMeaning: To load is to put objects into something.

textMeaning: To possess something is to have it or own it.

textMeaning: Rapidly means happening very fast.

textMeaning: To shine is to make a bright light.

textMeaning: If something is devastating, it causes great harm or damage to something or someone.
textExample: The tsunami had devastating effects on the seaside village.

textMeaning: Diversity is the quality or state of having many different forms, types, ideas, etc.
textExample: My company puts an emphasis on the importance on having cultural diversity.

textMeaning: An earthquake is a sudden shaking of a part of the Earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage.
textExample: The earthquake caused the road to crack in multiple places.

textMeaning: If something is endangered, it has become very rare and may eventually die out altogether.
textExample: The whooping crane is an endangered species.

textMeaning: Extinction is when a particular animal, plant, type of person, custom, skill, etc. stops existing.
textExample: The extinction of the dodo bird occurred in the 1600s.

textMeaning: We use forever in place of “for all future time” or “for a very long time.”
textExample: Michelle and Tanya want to be best friends forever.

textMeaning: We use generally in place of “in most cases” or “to most people.”
textExample: The suburbs are generally viewed as a good place to raise children.

textMeaning: Genocide is the deliberate murder of a whole group or race of people.
textExample: As a result of the genocide, many children have been orphaned.

textMeaning: To hit is to affect someone or something in a harmful or dangerous way.
textExample: The ship was hit by a violent storm.

textMeaning: To lose is to have something that is important or necessary taken from you or destroyed.
textExample: The family never thought they’d lose everything to fire.

textMeaning: If something is native, it refers to the place someone was born and raised.
textExample: Carlos is a hero in his native country of Brazil.

textMeaning: A percent is an amount that is equal to one one-hundredth of something.
textExample: Liz needs to get 80 percent on her test to pass the course.

textMeaning: A reason is a statement or fact that explains why something is the way it is, or why someone does, thinks, or says something.
textExample: The reason Eric is late for work is that he forgot to set his alarm.

textMeaning: A reference is the act of referring to something or someone.
textExample: My supervisor made a reference to the data I’d collected.

textMeaning: To burn is to use something as a source of energy.
textExample: Running is good exercise for people who want to burn fat and lose weight.

textMeaning: If something is urban, it is related to towns and cities.
textExample: It is common to see tall buildings in urban areas.

textMeaning: To check is to ask someone whether something is correct, true, or allowed.
textExample: Peter wants to check with the teacher to see if he is doing the assignment right.

textMeaning: A coconut is a large brown fruit that has a hard shell and white flesh.
textExample: A coconut produces a healthy oil.

textMeaning: Epilepsy is a medical condition that affects the brain and can make someone become unconscious or unable to control their movement for a short time.
textExample: The doctor diagnosed the patient with epilepsy.

textMeaning: Fat is an oily solid or liquid substance in food.
textExample: The fat contained in salmon, avocados, and nuts is healthy.

textMeaning: To gain is to gradually get more and more of a quality, feeling, etc.
textExample: Winning the award will help Steven gain confidence.

textMeaning: Glucose is a natural form of sugar that exists in plants and fruit.
textExample: People with diabetes need to check their glucose levels.

textMeaning: When something is high, it is greater than usual in amount, number, or degree.
textExample: The thermometer shows a high body temperature.

textMeaning: To keep is to stay in a particular state, condition, or position.
textExample: Brian needs to keep working in order to finish his project on time.

textMeaning: If something is known, it is something that people are aware of or have discovered.
textExample: Bob is known throughout the neighborhood as a burglars.

textMeaning: The liver is a large organ in the body that produces bile and cleans blood.
textExample: The professor showed us what the human liver looks like.

textMeaning: If something is low, it is smaller than usual in amount, number, or degree.
textExample: The temperature gets very low in the winter.

textMeaning: Management is the act or process of controlling and dealing with something.
textExample: Practicing yoga is good for stress management.

textMeaning: When something is metabolic, it relates to the chemical process in which plants or animals use food and water to make energy.
textExample: Fish have a very high metabolic rate.

textMeaning: Oil is a smooth, thick liquid made from plants or some animals, and is especially in cooking.
textExample: The chef put the oil in the pan and heated it up.

textMeaning: An olive is a small egg-shaped black or green fruit.

textMeaning: Performance is how well someone or something functions, works, etc.
textExample: Liam’s performance in the race was not his best.

textMeaning: If something is powerful, it has a strong effect.
textExample: This perfume has a powerful scent.

textMeaning: Starch is a substance that provides your body with energy and is found in foods such as wheat, potatoes, and rice.
textExample: Pasta is high in starch.

textMeaning: A summary is a short statement that contains the main information about something.

textMeaning: If something is analytic, it is related to logic and reasoning.

textMeaning: An area is a reasonably large place.
textExample: He was very familiar with the local area.

textMeaning: A bachelor is an unmarried man.

textMeaning: If something is cognitive, it is related to learning and knowing things.
textExample: After her physical examination, her cognitive skills were tested.

textMeaning: A collision is the act of two things hitting into each another.
textExample: The collision between the two cars created a loud noise.

textMeaning: If someone is competent, they are able to think or act successfully.

textMeaning: A diploma is a certificate proving that someone has completed their studies.
textExample: After four years of college, Mary finally had a diploma.

textMeaning: To excel at a subject or activity means to be very good at it.
textExample: Jenny excels at playing the piano.

textMeaning: Geology is the study of the Earth’s natural structures and how they change.
textExample: Because he studied geology, he knew how the mountains were formed.

textMeaning: Something that is integral is an important part of the whole.
textExample: She is an integral member of our team.

textMeaning: An intellect is a person’s ability to understand things easily.
textExample: She was known for her quick and strong intellect as well as her beauty.

textMeaning: Your job is the work you do to earn money.
textExample: He now has a high-paying job.

textMeaning: If someone is keen, they are intelligent.
textExample: Only a keen student could have solved that math problem.

textMeaning: The minimum is the smallest amount.
textExample: What is the minimum temperature in winter in this area?

textMeaning: Psychology involves the study of how the brain affects our thought and actions.
textExample: The psychology of seeing is a fascinating subject.

textMeaning: If something is radioactive, then it lets out, or is related to, radiation.
textExample: Radioactive states can be very bad for anyone’s health.

textMeaning: Relativity is a set of ideas about time and space developed by Albert Einstein.
textExample: Relativity teaches that light travels at the same speed throughout the universe.

textMeaning: Sociology is the study of human society, its organizations, and problems.
textExample: Sociology teaches that people’s problems are a result of their society.

textMeaning: If something is theoretical, it is based on theory rather than experience.
textExample: His conclusion was only theoretical and not meant to be publicized.

textMeaning: If someone is weak, they are not strong and healthy.
textExample: She is still weak after the illness.

textMeaning: An administrator is a person who controls a business, company, or organization.
textExample: Everyone in the store did whatever the administrator asked them to do.

textMeaning: To audit means to inspect financial records from a person or business.
textExample: The government usually audits companies that report lower than usual incomes.

textMeaning: If someone is corrupt, they break the law for money or fame.
textExample: The corrupt policemen didn’t arrest the man because he gave them money.

textMeaning: If someone is affluent, they are wealthy.
textExample: People in the city are usually more affluent than people in the country.

textMeaning: To automate something means to have machines or computers do the work.
textExample: When the bank automated, it started installing ATM machines.

textMeaning: To bribe someone means to illegally persuade them for a favor with money.
textExample: The judge was bribed so that she would set the suspect free.

textMeaning: To dispose of something means to get rid of it.
textExample: He disposed of the can by throwing it into the recycle bin.

textMeaning: An infrastructure is a collection of services needed to run a society or business.
textExample: Power lines are important parts of a city’s infrastructure.

textMeaning: A headquarters is a building where the bosses of a company work.
textExample: He took the long route to the headquarters because it was a nice day.

textMeaning: An incentive is what makes a person want to do something.
textExample: The chance of winning a prize was an incentive to get people to play the game.

textMeaning: To legislate means to make laws.
textExample: Senators have to legislate fairly so most people will enjoy the benefits.

textMeaning: If something is legitimate, then it is acceptable according to the law.
textExample: She found a legitimate plan to raise extra funds for her vacation.

textMeaning: Merchandise is goods ready to be purchased or sold.
textExample: The store added more merchandise because there were more shoppers.

textMeaning: To manipulate something means to skillfully or unfairly control or affect it.
textExample: The doctor manipulated the data to make it look like the cure was working.

textMeaning: Retail is the activity of selling goods to the public, often for personal use.
textExample: Although cheap to make, once a t-shirt reaches retail, it costs ten times as much.

textMeaning: Revenue is the income made by a company.
textExample: The new products really increased the business’s monthly revenue.

textMeaning: Rubbish is trash or waste.
textExample: The floor around the garbage can was covered with all kinds of rubbish.

textMeaning: A transaction is an act of buying or selling something.
textExample: Because the clerk was new at the job, the simple transaction took a long time.

textMeaning: A subsidy is money given by the government to companies to assist them.
textExample: The official gave the company a subsidy so it could open two new factories.

textMeaning: To violate a law, rule, or agreement means to break it.
textExample: I was given a ticket because the policeman said I violated a traffic law.

textMeaning: To assess something means to judge the structure, purpose, or quality of it.
textExample: She assessed the condition of the toy car before buying it.

textMeaning: To astonish someone means to greatly surprise them.
textExample: The number of people that came to her party astonished her.

textMeaning: The essence of something is its important qualities or basic characteristics.

textMeaning: If something is fabulous, it is extremely good.
textExample: This strawberry is the best I’ve ever had. It’s fabulous.

textMeaning: To extract something means to remove it.

textMeaning: Haste is speed in movement or action.
textExample: In order to get to the meeting in time, he proceeded with haste.

textMeaning: An impulse is a sudden thoughtless urge to do something.
textExample: Because of the scary noise, she had an impulse to run somewhere and hide.

textMeaning: When you inhibit something, you stop it from developing.

textMeaning: A molecule is the smallest basic unit that makes up a physical substance.

textMeaning: Latter describes something last in a series or the second choice of two things.

textMeaning: If something is ongoing, then it is still happening or still growing.

textMeaning: If someone is precise, then they are exact and careful about their work.
textExample: The builder was very precise about where he placed the nails.

textMeaning: Proximity is closeness in time, space, or relationships.
textExample: All the trees in the proximity of the beach had been cut down.

textMeaning: Publicity is public attention given to someone or something by the media.
textExample: She received a lot of publicity after her performance in the film.

textMeaning: The significance of something is the quality that makes it important.
textExample: The significance of the snowy weather was that we didn’t have to go to school.

textMeaning: A remedy is a cure for a disease, argument, or problem.
textExample: A good remedy for a headache is an aspirin and a glass of water.

textMeaning: If something is subsequent, then it comes after something else in time.
textExample: The flood and the subsequent rescue of those caught in the flood were on TV.

textMeaning: If something is synthetic, then it is made to be like something natural.
textExample: Clothing made out of synthetic fabrics is very effective at keeping people warm.

textMeaning: When a bad thing is acute, it is very severe and intense.
textExample: When she fell out of the tree, the girl felt an acute pain in her arm.

textMeaning: Aggression is behavior that is mean or violent to others.
textExample: The problem was only made worse by Mark’s aggression.

textMeaning: If something is terminal, then it causes or results in death.
textExample: Since his condition was not terminal, he felt a great sense of relief.

textMeaning: A biography is an account of someone’s life that is written by someone else.
textExample: We read a biography about Charles Darwin in science class.

textMeaning: To boost something means to increase or improve it.
textExample: Lowering prices boosts customers’ interest in shopping.

textMeaning: To clap means to hit one’s hands together to express pleasure or get attention.
textExample: After the speech, everyone in the crowd clapped their hands for the speaker.

textMeaning: Classical music is more formal and serious than popular music.
textExample: Beethoven is a composer of classical music.

textMeaning: To compel someone to do something means to force them to do it.
textExample: Traffic signs compel drivers to drive safely.

textMeaning: A creation is something original that is made.
textExample: We saw the creation of a new political party.

textMeaning: The dominance of a person is their state of being more powerful than others.
textExample: Large gorillas hit their chests to express their dominance over others.

textMeaning: When something is gorgeous, it is very pleasing and attractive.
textExample: The girl picked out a gorgeous dress to wear to the dance.

textMeaning: When something is inevitable, it is certain to happen or cannot be avoided.
textExample: It is inevitable that the days will get longer in the summer.

textMeaning: A legacy is an effect that exists because of a person or thing in the past.

textMeaning: A masterpiece is a very good painting, novel, movie, or other work of art.

textMeaning: If there are multiple things, there are many of them.

textMeaning: To narrate a story means to write about it or read it aloud.
textExample: This story was written by John, but Aaron is narrating it to the crowd.

textMeaning: When something is notorious, it is well known because of something bad.

textMeaning: When a thing is talked about overall, the whole thing is considered.
textExample: Overall, the party was a huge success.

textMeaning: A partiality is a tendency to prefer one thing to another.
textExample: She has a partiality for walking to school instead of driving.

textMeaning: When an act is spontaneous, it is not planned. It happens suddenly.
textExample: My wife made a spontaneous decision to buy a new sofa while I was at work.

textMeaning: A virtue is a good quality or way of behaving.
textExample: My best virtue is forgiveness.

textMeaning: An aspect is one part or feature of something.

textMeaning: An asset is a skill or quality that is useful or valuable.
textExample: The coach realized the boy’s speed was an asset to the team.

textMeaning: An assignment is task that is given to you to do.

textMeaning: An awareness is knowledge or perception or a situation or fact.
textExample: She has little awareness of what needs to be done.

textMeaning: A bud is a part of a plant that turns into a flower or a leaf.

textMeaning: To coordinate things is to make different parts work together.

textMeaning: Credit is something good in your favour.

textMeaning: To disprove something means to show that it is not true.

textMeaning: If something is humanitarian, it is connected to helping people’s lives.

textMeaning: A hypothesis is an idea about something that has not been proved yet.

textMeaning: When something is informative, it provides a lot of information.
textExample: The travel guide had a lot of informative facts about the region.

textMeaning: When something is optic, it relates to the eyes or light.

textMeaning: A premise is an idea on which something is based.

textMeaning: A rack is an object with shelves that holds things.

textMeaning: When something is spatial, it relates to the position and size of things.

textMeaning: To undertake a particular task is to take on the responsibility of doing it.

textMeaning: Wax is a substance that is slightly shiny and melts when heated.

textMeaning: When something is archeological, it relates to archeology.

textMeaning: A circuit is a piece of an electronic device that allows electricity to flow.

textMeaning: When something is viral, it is a disease or infection that is caused by a virus.

textMeaning: An administration is the group of people who manage a company or organization.
textExample: She hoped she could be promoted to a job in administration.

textMeaning: An acid is a chemical that can burn or dissolve other substances.

textMeaning: Administrative describes anything related to managing a company or organization.

textMeaning: Biotechnology is the use of living parts, such as cells, in industry and technology.

textMeaning: Whereby means by which or through which.
textExample: The mayor had a new bridge built whereby the citizens could cross the river.

textMeaning: To adapt means to change in order to deal with a new situation.
textExample: When he went to the new town, he had to adapt to all the weather changes.

textMeaning: Biological describes the process of life and living things.
textExample: In science class, we learned about the biological process of bacterial growth.

textMeaning: When something is cellular, it relates to the cells of animals or plants.
textExample: She used a microscope to see the activity at a cellular level.

textMeaning: When people are dynamic, they are lively and have creative ideas.
textExample: The new, dynamic employee came up with a good way to juggle his workload.

textMeaning: A fantasy is a pleasant situation that people think about but is unlikely to happen.
textExample: Becoming an astronaut is a fantasy shared by many children.

textMeaning: Heredity is the process of passing on features from parents to children.
textExample: The boy’s face is similar to his father’s because of heredity.

textMeaning: When something is internal, it exists or happens inside a person, object, or place.
textExample: We removed the outer case to reveal the computer’s internal wires.

textMeaning: When something is minimal, it is very small.
textExample: My lazy husband does a minimal amount of work around the house.

textMeaning: A pioneer is a person who is the first to discover or be involved in something.
textExample: He was a pioneer of computer programming.

textMeaning: To prescribe medicine means to tell someone to take it.
textExample: When I was sick, the doctor prescribed me flu medicine for me to take.

textMeaning: When things are respective, they relate separately to each person just mentioned.

textMeaning: When rules or systems are rigid, they are severe because they cannot be changed.

textMeaning: A sequence is a number of events or things that come one after another.
textExample: The dominos fell in a sequence of one after another.

textMeaning: Things which are similar are almost the same.

textMeaning: To substitute something or someone means to have them take the place of another.
textExample: When I ran out of juice, I had to substitute water to drink in the morning.

textMeaning: A surgeon is a doctor who is trained to do surgery.
textExample: The surgeon operated on the old man’s heart.

textMeaning: Therapy is treatment for a particular physical or mental illness or condition.
textExample: After she broke her legs, she used physical therapy to learn how to walk again.

textMeaning: To transfer something means to move it from one place to another.
textExample: The family transferred the groceries from the shopping cart to the car.

textMeaning: A transition is a process where there is a change from one form to another.

textMeaning: A transplant is an operation in which a damaged part of one’s body is replaced.

textMeaning: Astrology is the study of the stars in the belief that they influence people’s lives.

textMeaning: A couple is made of two things that go together.

textMeaning: To deviate is to move away from your proper course.

textMeaning: To differentiate things or people is to show the difference between them.
textExample: It was hard to differentiate between the identical twins.

textMeaning: To disrupt something or someone is to prevent them from working.

textMeaning: An equation is a math operation to determine the value of something.

textMeaning: To err means to make a mistake.

textMeaning: When something is erroneous, it is incorrect or only partly correct.

textMeaning: When an action is inadvertent, it is done without realizing what you are doing.

textMeaning: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

textMeaning: A multitude of things or people is a very large number of them.

textMeaning: The aristocracy is the highest class of people in certain societies.

textMeaning: A craze is a brief and popular activity or object.

textMeaning: If someone or something is reputable, then they have a good reputation.

textMeaning: An individual is a single member of a group.

textMeaning: A major event is a very important event.

textMeaning: An altar is a table used in churches.

textMeaning: Arthritis is an illness causing pain and swelling in a person’s joints.

textMeaning: Botany is the study of plants.

textMeaning: To chronicle an event means to record it.

textMeaning: Copper is a red-brown metal often used in electric wire and pipes.
textExample: Ancient hunters melted copper to make knives and spears.

textMeaning: A disease is an illness that causes specific problems.
textExample: He had a disease that caused him to lose his hearing.

textMeaning: Folklore is the collection of beliefs and stories of a culture.
textExample: India’s folklore has stories about great warriors written in long poems.

textMeaning: To infect someone means to give them an illness.
textExample: The common cold infects hundreds of millions of people each year.

textMeaning: To itch means to have an unpleasant feeling that you want to scratch.
textExample: The rough fabric in his shirt made his neck itch.

textMeaning: Literature is books, plays, and poetry.
textExample: Early American literature covers the poetry and stories from 1500 to 1800.

textMeaning: A millennium is 1000 years.
textExample: Stonehenge is believed to have been built about five millennia ago.

textMeaning: A myth is a traditional story that explains a culture’s history and beliefs.
textExample: In Greece, there was a myth about a woman who had snakes for hair.

textMeaning: To promote someone means to raise them to a higher position or rank.
textExample: After two years at the company, she was promoted to manager.

textMeaning: To relate to something means to have a connection with it.
textExample: A company’s plan usually relates to how much profit it can make.

textMeaning: A religion is a belief in a god or gods.
textExample: Their religion taught that people should forgive their enemies.

textMeaning: A sum is a specific amount of money.
textExample: He calculated the numbers to see what the sum of his bills would be.

textMeaning: A teller is a person who works with a bank’s customers.
textExample: The teller at the bank helped Kelly put money into a savings account.

textMeaning: If someone is trustworthy, they are honest and truthful.
textExample: Mary is one of the most trustworthy people I’ve ever met.

textMeaning: To update something means to make it more modern.
textExample: We need to update the programs on our computers.

textMeaning: A vein is a tube in the body that carries blood toward the heart.
textExample: The blue veins in my hand are just under my skin.

textMeaning: Venom is a poisonous substance that comes from animals or plants.
textExample: A snake’s venom can be used to cure the illnesses it creates.

textMeaning: Charity is an act of giving help, usually money, to those who need it.
textExample: Thanks to his friends’ charity, he had enough money to pay the rent.

textMeaning: Commerce is the activity of buying and selling things.
textExample: The new shopping mall increased the commerce in that section of town.

textMeaning: To condemn someone means to give them a specific punishment.
textExample: The judge condemned the criminal to five years in prison.

textMeaning: If something is cozy, then it is comfortable, warm, and relaxing.
textExample: The thick blanket made the bed very cozy.

textMeaning: To deplete an amount of something means to use all of it up.
textExample: All the driving he was doing was depleting his car’s fuel supply.

textMeaning: An economy is the money and businesses of a country or region.
textExample: The factory was good for the economy because it brought jobs to the area.

textMeaning: An empire is a large group of countries ruled by an emperor or empress.
textExample: The emperor built roads to make travel easier throughout the empire.

textMeaning: Goods are anything that can be bought or sold.
textExample: Shoes, hats, dresses, and purses were the goods she wanted to buy.

textMeaning: To heed something means to obey or follow it.
textExample: You should heed the advice on the sign and not drive so fast.

textMeaning: To hitchhike means to travel by asking for rides from passing vehicles.
textExample: She didn’t have a car, so she hitchhiked several miles to her brother’s home.

textMeaning: To mock someone means to tease them in a cruel way.
textExample: The girls mocked Nancy because she was a new student.

textMeaning: If someone is neutral, then they do not help either of the two fighting sides.
textExample: The girl’s friend remained neutral while the couple was arguing.

textMeaning: To persecute means to treat someone badly.
textExample: Dan felt persecuted because he was smaller than the other boys at school.

textMeaning: Pity is the feeling of sadness and kindness for those who are suffering.
textExample: Because she had pity for the lost boy, she helped him find his parents.

textMeaning: To reduce something means to make it smaller in size or fewer in number.
textExample: When the store reduced its prices, people wanted to shop there.

textMeaning: A scribe was a person whose job was to copy written works.
textExample: In ancient Egypt, scribes recorded important events.

textMeaning: A temper is someone’s mood or a chance that they might get angry.
textExample: She has a temper. Even the slightest mistakes make her angry.

textMeaning: A throne is the special chair in which a ruler sits.
textExample: Nobody except the king and queen sat in the thrones in the great hall.

textMeaning: Unity is the state of people working together for a certain purpose.
textExample: The project was finished early thanks to the unity of the workers.

textMeaning: A victor is a group or person that wins in a contest.
textExample: At the end of the game, the blue team were the victors.

textMeaning: If something is accurate, it is completely correct.
textExample: The story in the newspaper wasn’t very accurate.

textMeaning: To analyze something is to study it.
textExample: The scientist will analyze the blood sample.

textMeaning: An asteroid is a giant rock from outer space.
textExample: In 1908, a giant asteroid hit Siberia.

textMeaning: A controversy is a dispute about something that affects many people.
textExample: There has been a lot of controversy over the judge’s decision.

textMeaning: To evolve is to change over time.
textExample: Many people think that humans evolved from animals.

textMeaning: A factor is something that has an effect on the way another thing happens.
textExample: Smoking is the main factor that causes lung cancer.

textMeaning: If something is genetic, it is related to the genes in one’s body.
textExample: The color of one’s eyes is genetic.

textMeaning: A genome is the collection of all the genes in a living thing.
textExample: Understanding the human genome may help cure many diseases.

textMeaning: To be identical is to be the same as someone or something else.
textExample: James and John are identical twins.

textMeaning: A majority of something is more than half of the people or things in that group.
textExample: A majority of the people voted for Tom Smith in the election.

textMeaning: An intellectual is a very smart person.
textExample: We’ve always considered my Uncle Max to be the intellectual of the family.

textMeaning: A mammal is an animal that usually has hair and is not born from an egg.
textExample: Even though they live in water, whales are actually mammals.

textMeaning: To multiply is to increase in number.
textExample: In the past year, the number of people at work has multiplied by ten percent.

textMeaning: Offspring are the children of a person or the babies of an animal.
textExample: The dog’s offspring had the same color of fur as she did.

textMeaning: A pesticide is a substance used to kill insects.
textExample: The farmer sprayed his crops with a pesticide to keep bugs away.

textMeaning: To regulate something is to control how it happens.
textExample: The bank regulates how much money people can borrow.

textMeaning: To reinforce something is to make it stronger.
textExample: Peter reinforced his opinion with information from a book.

textMeaning: If someone or something is stricken by a disease or problem, they are badly affected by it.
textExample: The pilot landed the stricken airplane with difficulty.

textMeaning: If something is vast, it is very large.
textExample: The wealthy man bought a vast amount of land in the countryside.

textMeaning: A vegetarian is someone who does not eat any meat products.
textExample: I became a vegetarian because I don’t like the taste of meat.

textMeaning: A bowl is a dish with a round deep shape.
textExample: I put the fruit in the fruit bowl.

textMeaning: Cooking food involves making it ready to eat.
textExample: I really enjoy cooking, especially Italian food.

textMeaning: If something is dense, it has a lot of things close together.
textExample: I easily became lost in the dense forest.

textMeaning: Dignity is the ability to be calm and worthy of respect.
textExample: When his company went out of business, he faced it with dignity.

textMeaning: To dominate someone or something is to control them.
textExample: The loud man dominated the conversation.

textMeaning: If someone is hostile, they are angry and unfriendly.
textExample: We were happy to move away from our hostile neighbor.

textMeaning: If something is earthen, it is made of clay.
textExample: The house’s roof was made of earthen tiles.

textMeaning: If something is incorrect, it is wrong.
textExample: Your answer is incorrect. You need to correct it.

textMeaning: Your intake of food is the amount of food you take into your body.
textExample: The doctor said I needed to increase my intake of fruits and vegetables.

textMeaning: If someone does something likewise, they do the same thing as someone else.
textExample: If Joe is not going to school so he can go swimming, I want to do likewise.

textMeaning: Medication is medicine or drugs given to people who are sick.
textExample: The doctor gave me medication to treat my illness.

textMeaning: A machine is made by people and does work for us.
textExample: The machine was broken.

textMeaning: If something is obscure, it is not well known.
textExample: The old man travels the world in search of obscure books.

textMeaning: To oppress someone means to rule over them in a cruel and unfair way.
textExample: Free speech had been oppressed in his country.

textMeaning: To peel fruits and vegetables is to remove their skin.
textExample: He peeled the apple before eating it.

textMeaning: A prescription is permission from a doctor to get medicine.
textExample: The doctor gave me a prescription for my medication.

textMeaning: When you make progress, you get better at what you are doing.
textExample: There are clear signs of progress.

textMeaning: Sandy means covered with sand.
textExample: I love walking on a sandy beach.

textMeaning: Shortage comes from short and means not having enough.
textExample: During the dry season, there was a shortage of water.

textMeaning: If someone is skillful at something, they are very good at doing it.
textExample: The carpenter is very skillful at building houses.

textMeaning: An aircraft is a vehicle that flies in the sky, such as an airplane or helicopter.
textExample: At the museum in the airport, you can see a lot of old aircraft.

textMeaning: A celebrity is someone who is famous.
textExample: It was the highlight of the evening when the celebrities arrived.

textMeaning: Concrete is a substance made from stones.
textExample: The man covered the ground with concrete.

textMeaning: If someone is decisive, they make decisions quickly.
textExample: Our boss is very decisive, so it did not take long to organize the project.

textMeaning: An institute is an organization that is interested in research or teaching.
textExample: I am going to a lecture about Ancient Rome at the Historical Institute.

textMeaning: If someone is esteemed, many people like or respect them.
textExample: An esteemed scientist is coming to the university to talk about his discoveries.

textMeaning: If a person or plant is hardy, it is strong and can live through difficult conditions.
textExample: The farmer is a hardy man and doesn’t mind working outside.

textMeaning: If plants or animals are extinct, there are none left.
textExample: There used to be dinosaurs all over the world, but now they are extinct.

textMeaning: If something is ethical, it is the right thing to do.
textExample: Many people believe that it is ethical to help others in need.

textMeaning: Jealousy is a feeling of wanting something that somebody else has.
textExample: She felt a lot of jealousy when she saw her friend with a new car.

textMeaning: To migrate means to move from one place to another.
textExample: Many birds migrate to warmer countries in the winter.

textMeaning: To nurture something means to care for it as it grows or develops.
textExample: Robert nurtured his plants, and that is why they grow so well.

textMeaning: A principle is a belief about the correct way to behave.
textExample: To maintain principles, it’s vital to watch, listen, and speak carefully.

textMeaning: If something is overhead, it is located above you.
textExample: As we sat on the top of the hill, a plane flew overhead.

textMeaning: If a place is rural, it is in the countryside instead of the city.
textExample: I want to live in a small house in a rural area.

textMeaning: A species is a type of plant or animal.
textExample: There are 21 different species of butterfly in this forest.

textMeaning: A swamp is a very wet area of land.
textExample: There are lots of wild animals living in the swamp.

textMeaning: If a place is secluded, it is far away from any other place.
textExample: There was a secluded bench in the park.

textMeaning: To traverse means to move or travel through an area.
textExample: The explorer traversed the desert alone on a camel.

textMeaning: Zoology is a subject in which people study animals.
textExample: Helen wants to study zoology because she has always liked animals.

textMeaning: If someone acts accordingly, they act in a way that is suitable.
textExample: He feels like he did a good job and his boss should pay him accordingly.

textMeaning: When you cause something, you make it happen.
textExample: Tiredness caused the accident.

textMeaning: An anchor is a heavy object dropped from a boat to make it stay in one place.
textExample: When the ship reached its destination, the crew dropped the anchor.

textMeaning: Context is the situations that form the background of an event.
textExample: They studied the context of the battle before giving their presentation.

textMeaning: To designate someone or something means to give them a particular description.
textExample: The famous lighthouse was designated as a historical monument.

textMeaning: To distort something means to lie about it, or pull or twist out of shape.
textExample: The man’s lawyer distorted the facts so that he would be set free.

textMeaning: A dock is an enclosed area where ships go to be loaded, unloaded, and repaired.
textExample: The huge ship pulled into the dock, and the crew unloaded the cargo.

textMeaning: If you have a lot of energy, you have plenty of strength and can do lots of things.
textExample: If you lack energy, try eating better food.

textMeaning: If something is frequent, then it happens or is done often.
textExample: While Dad was sick, the doctor made frequent visits to his house.

textMeaning: The gears are the part of a motor that controls the speed.
textExample: My brother has a car with four gears.

textMeaning: When something is genuine, it is true or real.
textExample: After the painting was determined to be genuine, it sold for a million dollars.

textMeaning: Grease is an oily substance put on moving parts so they work smoothly, or oil or fat in cooking.
textExample: When I was done working on the car, I had grease all over my hands.

textMeaning: Knowledge is what you know.
textExample: He has trouble putting his knowledge into practice.

textMeaning: When you omit something, you leave it out or do not do it.
textExample: I omitted some important information: he is not coming.

textMeaning: To offset means to use one thing to cancel out the effect of another thing.
textExample: Increased wages are offset by higher prices for goods.

textMeaning: To overlap something means to cover a piece of it.
textExample: The gift on top overlaps the other gift on the bottom.

textMeaning: When something is secondhand, it has been owned by someone else.
textExample: Her secondhand jeans were a bit faded in the front.

textMeaning: When you have skill at doing a job, you are good at doing it.
textExample: She worked with great skill and confidence.

textMeaning: A slot is a narrow opening in a machine or container.
textExample: To operate the machine, put your coins into the slot.

textMeaning: A tactic is a careful plan to achieve something.
textExample: Sam thought of a good tactic to attract more business.

textMeaning: If something is beneficial, it is good for you.
textExample: Drinking milk every day is beneficial for your bones.

textMeaning: A birthplace is a place where a person is born or where something started.
textExample: China is the birthplace of chopsticks.

textMeaning: The capacity of something is the amount of things that can be put in it.
textExample: The parking lot has reached its full capacity.

textMeaning: If something is comparative, it is being judged based on something else.
textExample: The money that John has is comparative to that of most other adults.

textMeaning: If something is comprehensive, it has all the details about something else.
textExample: The teacher gave us a comprehensive review for the exam.

textMeaning: To conserve something is to protect it from being ruined or used completely.
textExample: The group worked to conserve the beauty of Europe’s national parks.

textMeaning: If something is crucial, it is extremely important to another thing.
textExample: Clean air is crucial to the survival of humans, plants, and animals.

textMeaning: Cumulative describes an increase by adding one after another.
textExample: The cumulative snowfall in the area is fifty centimeters per year.

textMeaning: To deposit something is to put it into a place or another thing.
textExample: I deposited the money into my bank account.

textMeaning: To distribute something is to give it to a number of people.
textExample: The teacher distributed crayons and markers to her students.

textMeaning: The equator is an imaginary line that splits the Earth into north and south.
textExample: The equator crosses the northern part of South America.

textMeaning: Exotic describes something unusual because it is from far away.
textExample: Rebecca tried many exotic foods on her trip to Africa.

textMeaning: If something is federal, it relates to the government of a country.
textExample: Sometimes federal laws are different from state laws.

textMeaning: A formation is the way that something is made.
textExample: The formation of ice happens when water freezes.

textMeaning: The frequency of something is the number of times that it happens.
textExample: The frequency of rainstorms is very high, especially during the spring.

textMeaning: An objective is a goal or plan that someone has.
textExample: My objective this week is to finish my homework by 7:30 every night.

textMeaning: Oxygen is a gas that all living things need to breathe.
textExample: She thinks there is more oxygen in the air in the country than in the city.

textMeaning: A rainforest is a forest that is in a place where it rains very often.
textExample: The rainforest is home to many animals.

textMeaning: A strategy is a plan for how to do something.
textExample: The team came up with a strategy to win the game.

textMeaning: If an area is wooded, it is covered with trees.
textExample: Jim and Ben decided to go hiking in the wooded area by the river.

textMeaning: Avail is help or benefit.
textExample: His studying was to no avail because he failed the test.

textMeaning: To dread is to be afraid of something that could, or is going to, happen.
textExample: I dread the possibility that I will not get into college.

textMeaning: To define means to clearly state, show, or explain what something is.
textExample: People define success in many different ways.

textMeaning: To expand is to become bigger in size.
textExample: A balloon will expand as you blow air into it.

textMeaning: If something is fundamental, it is a basic part of something.
textExample: The fundamental rules of basketball are easy.

textMeaning: If something is horrifying, it is frightening and very unpleasant.
textExample: There was a horrifying car accident today.

textMeaning: If someone is incredulous about something, they do not believe that it is true.
textExample: She was incredulous that monkeys could ever drive a car.

textMeaning: To linger is to last for a long time.
textExample: The smell of fresh cookies lingered in the bakery.

textMeaning: An organism is a living thing, especially a very small one.
textExample: We studied the organism under the microscope.

textMeaning: To paraphrase is to make someone else’s writing or speech shorter.
textExample: The students were asked to paraphrase the story they had just heard.

textMeaning: A plague is a serious disease that quickly spreads to many people.
textExample: A plague in Europe killed millions of people.

textMeaning: If something happens presently, it is happening right now.
textExample: Presently, our profits are good, but by next year we can do even better.

textMeaning: If something is random, it happens without any pattern or reason.
textExample: Young children often ask random questions.

textMeaning: A riot is a crowd that reacts to bad news by violently breaking laws.
textExample: A riot broke out after the candidate lost the election.

textMeaning: To scribble is to write something quickly without caring about how it looks.
textExample: I scribbled a rough diagram of our plan and gave it to him.

textMeaning: A shrine is a religious building built to honor a person, event, or god.
textExample: He prayed at the shrine for an hour.

textMeaning: Solitude is the state of being totally alone.
textExample: John lives a life of solitude because he doesn’t get along well with people.

textMeaning: If something is stark, then it is severe or clear in appearance or outline.
textExample: There is a stark contrast between their test scores.

textMeaning: To summon a person is to ask them to come to you.
textExample: We summoned the doctor as soon as we noticed she was sick.

textMeaning: To worsen is to get worse.
textExample: The weather suddenly worsened, and we had to stay inside.

textMeaning: An automobile is a car.
textExample: The first automobiles were very different from the ones that exist today.

textMeaning: If something is confidential, it must be kept secret.
textExample: The information from the meeting is confidential.

textMeaning: A candidate is a person who is competing to win something such as a job.
textExample: Alice is the best candidate for the job.

textMeaning: If something is corporate, it is related to a large business.
textExample: Tom enjoys working in the corporate world.

textMeaning: To enhance something is to make it better.
textExample: Amy’s blue shirt really enhances the color of her eyes.

textMeaning: An era is a period of time that has something special about it.
textExample: During the medieval era, knights wore protective armor.

textMeaning: To incorporate is to add something to another thing.
textExample: I decided to incorporate a new ingredient into my cake recipe.

textMeaning: A guideline is a rule about how to do something.
textExample: Before they began the project, the teacher gave them some guidelines.

textMeaning: If something is mobile, it can be moved easily.
textExample: Mobile phones are convenient because you can use them anywhere.

textMeaning: To interact is to talk to or do something with another person.
textExample: The kids began to interact when the adults left the room.

textMeaning: An interval is the time between two things happening.
textExample: Tony rested for brief intervals while he worked in the yard.

textMeaning: To modify something is to change it a little bit.
textExample: I modified my outfit by adding a belt to it.

textMeaning: If two things are parallel, they are the same distance away from each other (along their entire length).
textExample: There are two yellow parallel lines dividing both sides of traffic.

textMeaning: A phenomenon is something that can be seen as it is happening.
textExample: I thought the lights were a strange phenomenon, but they were just shooting stars.

textMeaning: To ridicule is to make fun of something in a mean way.
textExample: The other students ridicule Peter’s foreign accent.

textMeaning: To pollute means to make air, water, or land dirty, unclean, or foul.
textExample: The careless factory polluted the river with chemicals.

textMeaning: If something is solar, it is related to the sun.
textExample: Using solar energy is good for the environment.

textMeaning: A territory is a piece of land that belongs to a country but isn’t a state.
textExample: Gibraltar is a territory of Great Britain.

textMeaning: A tournament is a competition, usually with many people participating.
textExample: My dad is playing in a golf tournament tomorrow.

textMeaning: Transportation is any type of vehicle that can carry people or things.
textExample: I don’t have a car, so my normal transportation is the train.

textMeaning: A bill is a statement of money owed for goods or for a service.
textExample: I have so many bills that I do not know how to pay them all.

textMeaning: Chaos is a situation that is confusing and not ordered.
textExample: His presentation was in chaos. I couldn’t understand what he meant.

textMeaning: A boundary is the line where one area of land stops and another begins.
textExample: This fence shows the boundary between our yard and yours.

textMeaning: If a person is consistent, they always have the same behavior or attitude.
textExample: Sara comes in every day and is our most consistent worker.

textMeaning: If food is organic, it is grown without adding chemicals to it.
textExample: The organic carrots are more expensive, but they’re better for you.

textMeaning: If someone or something is doomed, they are going to fail or be destroyed.
textExample: Since I spent all my money, my date with Jane is doomed.

textMeaning: If something is martial, it is related to fighting or war.
textExample: Karate is a martial art that began many years ago in Japan.

textMeaning: An heir is a person who receives the money or property of someone who dies.
textExample: The princess was the heir to the king and queen’s throne.

textMeaning: A cyclone is a large storm with heavy rain and winds that spin in a circle.
textExample: Hundreds of homes were damaged by the cyclone.

textMeaning: Poultry is a bird, such as a chicken, that is used for meat and eggs.
textExample: He raises poultry and sells their meat for extra money.

textMeaning: To scramble is to move somewhere quickly and desperately.
textExample: The hikers scrambled down the side of the hill.

textMeaning: A stance is an attitude about an issue that someone states clearly.
textExample: My stance is that using oil and gas is bad for the environment.

textMeaning: A sergeant is a soldier or police officer of middle rank.
textExample: He was promoted to sergeant after a year in the army.

textMeaning: If you describe something as sheer, it is complete and total.
textExample: I was impressed by her sheer dedication to jogging.

textMeaning: A telegraph is a method of sending electric messages on wires.
textExample: In the 1900s, the telegraph was the fastest way to send a message.

textMeaning: Textile is cloth that has been woven or knitted.
textExample: The blue textile was going to be used to make blouses.

textMeaning: A typhoon is a large tropical storm that moves in circles.
textExample: Thousands of people lost electricity after a typhoon hit Australia.

textMeaning: To wail is to show sadness by crying loudly.
textExample: The baby wailed because it was hungry.

textMeaning: A tornado is a tube-shaped formation of air that spins very quickly.
textExample: During a tornado, the safest place to be is underground.

textMeaning: A wardrobe is the collection of all of a person’s clothing.
textExample: She bought some new clothes to expand her wardrobe.

textMeaning: Something that has an adverse effect can be harmful, dangerous, or unfavorable.
textExample: I worry that the tornado will have an adverse effect on the farm.

textMeaning: An alternate option is a different option.
textExample: Taking the bus and driving to work are alternate ways to travel.

textMeaning: Materials that are biodegradable break down naturally into substances that do not harm the environment.
textExample: I use biodegradable compost to feed my garden.

textMeaning: When something is boxed, it is inside a package.
textExample: Justine brought a boxed gift to the birthday party.

textMeaning: If you choke on something, it stops you from breathing.
textExample: The gum Malinda swallowed made her choke.

textMeaning: To discard something is to throw it away.
textExample: After repairing the window, discard any broken glass.

textMeaning: When something is convenient, it saves you time or effort.
textExample: Walking through the park is a convenient way to exercise on the way to work.

textMeaning: A dolphin is a large sea mammal that breathes air.
textExample: Intelligent dolphins have learned to communicate with humans.

textMeaning: Ecologically means that something is done in a way that concerns living organisms and the environment.
textExample: We planted our garden according to ecologically correct practices.

textMeaning: Something that is fatal results in someone’s death.
textExample: Being shot by the attacker proved fatal to the victim.

textMeaning: The number of times something happens is the incidence of the event.
textExample: We need to increase the incidence of success in school.

textMeaning: Municipal means that something belongs to a city or local government.
textExample: The municipal parking lot downtown can fit one hundred cars.

textMeaning: Overuse occurs when something is utilized too many times.
textExample: Rochelle’s overuse of the exercise bike caused the gears to break.

textMeaning: A pond is a freshwater body that is smaller than a lake.
textExample: I learned to swim at the pond behind the recreation center.

textMeaning: When you recycle an object, you use its parts to make something else.
textExample: We recycle our newspapers so that they can be made into packing boxes.

textMeaning: An object that is reusable can be utilized over and over again.
textExample: Saburo keeps his empty jelly jars because they are reusable for storing sewing supplies.

textMeaning: When something is stuffed, it is pushed into a small space.
textExample: The newspapers were all stuffed into the drawer.

textMeaning: A tragic event causes sadness because it might involve death or suffering.
textExample: The entire community attended the memorial service for the victims of the tragic fire.

textMeaning: To utilize something is to use it for a specific purpose.
textExample: The team can utilize the lab equipment to complete the experiment.

textMeaning: A whale is a very large mammal that lives in the ocean.
textExample: We were surprised when a whale surfaced next to our boat.

textMeaning: If something is ambiguous, it is not entirely clear.
textExample: It’s ambiguous as to whether a newborn baby looks like a girl or a boy.

textMeaning: An amateur is a person who does something for fun and isn’t paid for it.
textExample: The amateur took pictures just as well as the person who worked for money.

textMeaning: If someone is anonymous, no one knows who he or she is.
textExample: An anonymous donor gave a thousand dollars to the museum.

textMeaning: To attain something is to succeed at something or to get something you want.
textExample: If you want to attain a healthy body, you must exercise every day.

textMeaning: Autonomy is another word for freedom or independence.
textExample: In the 1800s, the people of India fought for autonomy from Britain.

textMeaning: A concession is something that one person gives up to another.
textExample: China gave Hong Kong to Britain as a concession after the war.

textMeaning: Decay is the result of something slowly being broken down or destroyed naturally.
textExample: The decay in the old building was obvious.
