textMeaning: To testify means to give evidence as a witness.
textExample: The judge listened while the victim testified about the robbery.

textMeaning: A tumult is a loud and confused noise made by a large crowd of people.
textExample: She couldn’t hear her friend over the tumult of the other excited guests.

textMeaning: To underestimate something or someone means to think less of them than they really are.
textExample: We lost the game because we underestimated the other team’s skill.

textMeaning: Uproar is loud noise caused by people who are very angry or upset.
textExample: The fans made a great uproar when their team lost the game.

textMeaning: To accelerate means to increase in speed.
textExample: When he stepped on the gas pedal, the motorcycle accelerated.

textMeaning: If you do something anew, you do it again, possibly in a different way.
textExample: Although he had failed his driving test, he decided to try it anew.

textMeaning: A defect is a part of something that is wrong or missing.
textExample: All these bottles have a defect and must be sent back to the warehouse.

textMeaning: If something is dreary, then it is dull, dark, and lifeless.
textExample: After the fire, this section of forest is rather dreary.

textMeaning: To duplicate something means to copy it.
textExample: She duplicated her friend’s movements like she was in front of a mirror.

textMeaning: If something is electromagnetic, it is related to electricity and magnetic fields.
textExample: Different colors of light come from different levels of electromagnetic energy.

textMeaning: An electron is a particle in all atoms that has a negative electric charge.
textExample: The number of electrons in an atom determines its charge.

textMeaning: To glide means to fly on extended wings with little or no effort.
textExample: When the wind is blowing, birds can glide easily through the sky.

textMeaning: If someone is ingenious, then they are very smart.
textExample: Charles was the only person ingenious enough to repair the plane’s engines.

textMeaning: An innovation is a product, or an idea, that is new or very original.
textExample: Mrs. Johnson made a great innovation to the company’s business plan.

textMeaning: If something or someone is innovative, they can think in creative ways.
textExample: Since Peter was so innovative, he was chosen to lead the science team.

textMeaning: To launch something means to make it go into motion.
textExample: The boat launched from the dock and foated down the river.

textMeaning: If something is meteorological, it is concerned with the science of weather.
textExample: The thunderstorm was so large that it became a great meteorological event.

textMeaning: Meteorology is the science that studies the weather.
textExample: In order to understand the weather better, you should study meteorology.

textMeaning: To penetrate something means to enter into it.
textExample: The knife easily penetrated the surface of the orange.

textMeaning: A persistent person does not give up and keeps on working.
textExample: They made persistent attempts to get him to eat.

textMeaning: Propulsion is the force that moves something forward.
textExample: The propulsion lifted the rocket into the sky.

textMeaning: To simulate something means to copy its actions or characteristics.
textExample: The French language teacher could simulate the accent of a French citizen.

textMeaning: To spur someone means to urge them into action.
textExample: The coach’s speech spurred her team into playing the best game of their lives.

textMeaning: To stimulate something means to cause or to increase activity in it.
textExample: Doctors sometimes use electric shock to stimulate a patient’s heartbeat.

textMeaning: If something is done beforehand, then it is done in advance.
textExample: He packed his luggage beforehand, so he was able to leave right away.

textMeaning: Something blurred is not seen clearly.
textExample: There was blurred photographs of what was supposed to be a flying saucer.

textMeaning: If a temperature is given in centigrade, it is the same as the temperature in Celsius.
textExample: During the spring time, the temperature gets as warm as 26 degrees centigrade.

textMeaning: To chatter means to talk quickly about unimportant things.
textExample: The children chattered in the back of the classroom.

textMeaning: To deteriorate means to become steadily worse.
textExample: The nation’s economy continued to deteriorate despite the politicians’ efforts.

textMeaning: To condense a gas means to make it a liquid.
textExample: The cool air made tiny drops of water condense on the tops of the grass.

textMeaning: A concerto is music played with an orchestra but features a solo instrument.
textExample: The piano concerto has a section in which only the piano plays.

textMeaning: Degree is a unit for measuring temperature.
textExample: The thermometer recorded a temperature of 38 degrees Celsius.

textMeaning: An exterior is the outside surface of something.
textExample: The exterior of the nut was hard and woody, but the inside was soft and delicious.

textMeaning: If someone or something is hearty, then they are loud and happy.
textExample: The grandmother ended her story with a hearty laugh that pleased her grandchild.

textMeaning: A manor is a large house with many rooms.
textExample: The manor had over forty rooms and beautiful gardens.

textMeaning: If someone is hospitable, they are friendly to strangers.
textExample: At dinner, my dad was very hospitable to my friends.

textMeaning: Humor can be something that makes you laugh, and it can also refer to your feelings.
textExample: He woke up in an ill humor, angry at everyone.

textMeaning: A monastery is a building in which monks live.
textExample: The monks at this monastery are famous for their bread and music.

textMeaning: A nursery is a room where babies and children sleep, play, or are cared for.
textExample: The children kissed their parents goodnight and went upstairs to the nursery.

textMeaning: A parcel is a package of things to be carried or mailed somewhere.
textExample: The parcel looked like it had been stepped on by someone.

textMeaning: If something is outstretched, then it is extended to its full length.
textExample: The cat stood on its back legs with its front legs outstretched.

textMeaning: A profile is an outline of a face, usually as seen from the side.
textExample: The drawing of Olivia’s profile came out very well.

textMeaning: If something is winding, then it follows a twisting course.
textExample: The winding river turned and looped around the hills.

textMeaning: To zip something means to close it with a zipper.
textExample: She zipped her backpack closed after putting her books inside it.

textMeaning: To abolish something means to put an end to it, such as a system or law.
textExample: President Lincoln abolished slavery in the US.

textMeaning: To amend something means to change it to improve or make it accurate.
textExample: The countries were in agreement that the treaty needed to be amended.

textMeaning: To aspire means to have a strong desire to achieve or do something.
textExample: George aspired to be a doctor from a young age.

textMeaning: To censor information means to remove it if it is dangerous, rude, or rebellious.
textExample: To protect innocent people, the location of the bomb was censored.

textMeaning: A charter is a document that describes the rights of an organization or group.
textExample: The company charter explained that all employees had to pay a tax.

textMeaning: A constitution is a document of principles for a government.
textExample: The country’s constitution said a prime minister could only serve three terms.

textMeaning: To disseminate information or knowledge means to distribute it.
textExample: The organization disseminates information about the dangers of smoking.

textMeaning: When a place is cosmopolitan, it is full of people from many different places.
textExample: There are dozens of different types of restaurants in a cosmopolitan city.

textMeaning: To fatter people means to praise them in an effort to please them.
textExample: He was just flattering me when he said that my new dress looked gorgeous.

textMeaning: When someone is infamous, they are well known for something bad.
textExample: That news channel is infamous for presenting biased information.

textMeaning: If one is lame, they cannot walk properly due to an injury to the leg or foot.
textExample: The terrible accident left many people dead and several others lame.

textMeaning: To limp means to walk with difficulty because someone’s leg or foot is hurt.
textExample: After the injury, the player limped off of the field.

textMeaning: An outburst is a sudden, strong expression of an emotion.
textExample: There was an outburst of cheers when the comedian took the stage.

textMeaning: When a behavior is pathological, it is extreme, unacceptable, and sometimes a symptom of disease.
textExample: The pathological liar could not even tell the truth about unimportant matters.

textMeaning: When something is phenomenal, it is unusually great.
textExample: The child’s ability to play the piano is nothing short of phenomenal.

textMeaning: A poll is a survey in which people give their opinions about important things.
textExample: The poll showed that many people support the plan to stop gang violence.

textMeaning: Remorse is a strong feeling of sadness and regret.
textExample: When I realized what I had done, I felt remorse for my actions.

textMeaning: Secrecy is the behavior of keeping things secret.
textExample: The secrecy of the big organization made the government nervous.

textMeaning: To tackle something means to deal with it in a determined and efficient way.
textExample: Such social problems need to be tackled right away.

textMeaning: A trance is a state where people seem asleep and have no control of themselves.
textExample: The woman’s powerful eyes often put men in a trance.

textMeaning: A coward is a person who lacks courage to do risky or dangerous things.
textExample: A firefighter cannot be a coward. They have to be able to act quickly.

textMeaning: To delete something means to remove or erase written material.
textExample: Several lines had been deleted from her speech.

textMeaning: If someone is earnest, then they are honest.
textExample: The child was very earnest when she told her mother how she broke the dish.

textMeaning: If something is ethnic, then it is related to a group with a similar culture.
textExample: Many sections of the city are home to different ethnic communities.

textMeaning: To exclude someone means to not accept them into a group.
textExample: Carol was excluded from the contest because her friend was a judge.

textMeaning: If something is firsthand, then it is from an original source.
textExample: If you want firsthand knowledge, ask someone who saw it.

textMeaning: If someone is fluent in a language, then they are able to speak it very well.
textExample: She was so fluent in German that you’d have thought she was from Germany.

textMeaning: If something is imperial, then it is related to an empire.
textExample: These old imperial coins were once used in the Roman Empire.

textMeaning: If something is inclusive, then it is open to all groups and people in society.
textExample: A more inclusive event would have allowed children to attend.

textMeaning: A legislature is the section of a government that makes laws.
textExample: The senator had served ten years in the national legislature.

textMeaning: If something is linguistic, then it is concerned with language.
textExample: A linguistic way of studying culture focuses on words within that culture.

textMeaning: If someone is monolingual, then they speak only one language.
textExample: In today’s global economy, being monolingual limits your opportunities.

textMeaning: A patriot is someone who loves, supports, and defends their country.
textExample: Every year, young patriots join their countries’ militaries.

textMeaning: Nationality is an identity based on the nation from which you come.
textExample: His nationality is German, but he speaks French, Spanish, and Korean.

textMeaning: To prosecute someone means to take legal action against them.
textExample: They were prosecuted for fishing in the river without a permit.

textMeaning: If something is racial, then it is related to a race or races.
textExample: The differences between racial groups are physical characteristics and culture.

textMeaning: If something is solemn, then it is serious and honest.
textExample: The professor preferred a solemn relationship between him and his students.

textMeaning: Tact is the ability to avoid offending people when dealing with problems.
textExample: Since both sides would not agree, it required someone with tact to make peace.

textMeaning: Solidarity is a union formed from common responsibilities or interests.
textExample: All the citizens came together in a show of solidarity to create change.

textMeaning: To undermine someone means to betray them or weaken their efforts or authority.
textExample: The documents helped to undermine the workers’ trust in their bosses’ honesty.

textMeaning: To constrain something means to limit its development.
textExample: Jim cannot join us because he is constrained by previous plans.

textMeaning: A depot is a bus or train station.
textExample: He waited for his mother to arrive at the depot.

textMeaning: The forefinger is the finger between one’s thumb and middle finger.
textExample: He shouted, “There it is!” and pointed with his forefinger.

textMeaning: To emulate people means to imitate them because they are greatly admired.
textExample: As a small boy, he always tried to emulate his big brother.

textMeaning: The guts are all the organs inside a person or animal.
textExample: The doctor can tell you every process that happens in one’s guts.

textMeaning: When something is inherent, it is a natural part of something else.
textExample: Sweating is an inherent bodily function when exercising.

textMeaning: To intimidate means to frighten others.
textExample: My dad intimidates my friends whenever they visit.

textMeaning: A janitor is a person who makes repairs and takes care of a building.
textExample: The school janitor cleaned up the messy cafeteria.

textMeaning: When something is moist, it is slightly wet.
textExample: The ground is still moist from the rain last night.

textMeaning: Nope is an informal way of saying “no.”
textExample: He asked if I had any money, and I had to say, “Nope.”

textMeaning: To prod means to push someone or something with a finger or pointed object.
textExample: The bully prodded me in the chest with her finger.

textMeaning: A ransom is a sum of money paid to a kidnapper to set the person free.
textExample: He kidnapped the prince and demanded $1 million as a ransom.

textMeaning: To restrain someone or something means to use physical strength to stop them.
textExample: Mike restrained Allen from reaching the door.

textMeaning: Saliva is the watery liquid in people’s mouths that helps in digestion.
textExample: The baby could not keep the saliva from dripping out of its mouth.

textMeaning: To spit means to force liquid from one’s mouth.
textExample: He emerged from the pool and spit water from his mouth.

textMeaning: To sprint means to run very fast over a short distance.
textExample: The kids didn’t want to be late to class, so they sprinted to the bus stop.

textMeaning: A stunt is something that is done in order to get attention or publicity.
textExample: The man jumped over the cars as a promotional stunt.

textMeaning: When people are tolerant, they are respectful of others’ rights and beliefs.
textExample: The tolerant leader thought that everyone was equal regardless of race.

textMeaning: A vampire is a fictional monster that sleeps in a coffin and sucks people’s blood.
textExample: The vampire snuck up on the woman and bit her neck.

textMeaning: To yawn means to open one’s mouth wide and breathe in air.
textExample: The child yawned and stretched her arms before going to bed for the night.

textMeaning: If something is adjoining, it is next to or joined with a building or room.
textExample: I couldn’t sleep because the people in the adjoining room were loud.

textMeaning: To allege something is to say that it is true without offering proof.
textExample: The little girl had alleged that her older brother hid her favorite doll.

textMeaning: An arch is a curved opening formed under a structure such as a bridge or doorway.
textExample: The arch of the bridge was not high enough for the tall boat to pass underneath.

textMeaning: To assemble means to get together in one place.
textExample: The parents assembled to discuss ways to improve their children’s education.

textMeaning: A casualty is a person killed or injured in a war or an accident.
textExample: The only casualty in the car accident was a woman who broke her arm.

textMeaning: To erect something means to build it.
textExample: The king erected two towers on the north and south sides of his castle.

textMeaning: If something is foul, then it is very unpleasant.
textExample: He wouldn’t let his dog drink from the water because it had a foul smell.

textMeaning: A hectare is a unit of measure equal to 10,000 square meters.
textExample: His family farm covered many hectares.

textMeaning: To heighten an emotion means to increase the intensity of it.
textExample: The pleasant music heightened their enjoyment of the wonderful dinner.

textMeaning: Hospitality is friendly behavior and entertainment, shown to guests or strangers.
textExample: The travelers were amazed at the hospitality given them by the hotel’s staf.

textMeaning: A mansion is a large and expensive home.
textExample: The mansion had thirty bedrooms, two kitchens, and a pool.

textMeaning: To outnumber a group means to have a greater number than it.
textExample: The girls outnumbered the boys at the school by four to one.

textMeaning: If someone is overjoyed, then they are extremely happy.
textExample: He was overjoyed by the news of his promotion.

textMeaning: A pasture is an area of land covered with grass for animals to use as food.
textExample: The sheep were taken to a pasture where there was more grass.

textMeaning: A petition is a written request asking an authority to do something.
textExample: The citizens all signed a petition asking the mayor to repair the sidewalks.

textMeaning: To renovate a building means to repair it, or to build new structures on it.
textExample: The old fire station was renovated into an apartment building.

textMeaning: To revise something means to change it, or update it to make it better.
textExample: When the editor discovered certain facts were wrong, he revised the book.

textMeaning: A slab is a large, thick, flat piece of stone, concrete, metal, or wood.
textExample: I looked at various slabs of stone to decorate my house.

textMeaning: A terrace is an open area that is connected to a house or an apartment.
textExample: In the afternoons, she liked to sit on the terrace and check her email.

textMeaning: Turf is a section of grass and the dirt in which it grows.
textExample: After the game, the turf looked ragged.

textMeaning: If something is analogous to another thing, then it is like it in certain ways.
textExample: The relationship with his teacher was analogous to that of a son and mother.

textMeaning: Binoculars are a device used for seeing things that are far away.
textExample: He could see the ship on the horizon only if he used his binoculars.

textMeaning: The bulk of something is its size.
textExample: The large elephant moved its bulk with legs as strong as tree trunks.

textMeaning: If something comprises something else, it consists of or is made up of it.
textExample: Our school’s football team is mostly comprised with seniors.

textMeaning: To depict something means to show or portray it, often using art.
textExample: The statue’s face depicted the general’s determination and courage.

textMeaning: Fahrenheit is a temperature scale where water freezes at 32° and boils at 212°.
textExample: When the temperature dropped to 32° Fahrenheit, it started snowing.

textMeaning: A grove is a small group of trees.
textExample: All the trees in this grove are apple trees.

textMeaning: Ore is the raw form of rock or material from which a valuable metal is taken.
textExample: The factory melted the ore and used it to make iron products.

textMeaning: If something is dual, then it is made up of two parts.
textExample: The room had a dual function. It was a living room, but at night it was a bedroom.

textMeaning: To fulfill something means to achieve or finish it.
textExample: The professor did not fulfill his promise not to miss a single class.

textMeaning: The outback is the wild inland region of Australia where very few people live.
textExample: Many Australian farmers use the outback to raise cattle.

textMeaning: A shortcut is a route that is shorter than the main route.
textExample: We got to the house early because we took a shortcut through the forest.

textMeaning: A pier is a structure that extends into a body of water.
textExample: If you want to catch bigger fish, then go to the far end of the pier.

textMeaning: To outweigh something means to exceed it in value, amount, or importance.
textExample: Finding a warm place to sleep outweighed the need to find something to eat.

textMeaning: A paradox is a true statement or real event that seems illogical.
textExample: The paradox of her work was that the less she worked, the more she got done.

textMeaning: A tarif is a tax or fee paid on certain imports or exports.
textExample: Our tarif on imported wool makes foreign wool more expensive.

textMeaning: To tilt something means to tip it into a sloping position.
textExample: She tilted her glass and almost spilled some of the wine inside.

textMeaning: The whereabouts of someone or something is the place where they are.
textExample: The police looked for the lost dog, but its whereabouts were still unknown.

textMeaning: A thermometer is a device that measures temperature.
textExample: The thermometer outside the window indicated that it was a hot day today.

textMeaning: If a statement is vice versa, then its two main ideas are switched with one another.
textExample: Students learn from their teachers, and vice versa.
